aiNews.title: Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff: This isn’t our first SaaSpocalypse
aiNews.summary: Salesforce reported a solid year-end earnings and then pulled out all the stops to ward off more talk of the death of its business to AI.

aiNews.title: Gushwork bets on AI search for customer leads — and early results are emerging
aiNews.summary: Gushwork has raised $9 million in a seed round led by SIG and Lightspeed. The startup has seen early customer traction from AI search tools like ChatGPT.

aiNews.title: Anthropic acquires computer-use AI startup Vercept after Meta poached one of its founders
aiNews.summary: Seattle-based Vercept developed complex agentic tools, including a computer-use agent that could complete tasks inside applications like a person with a laptop would.

aiNews.title: Nvidia has another record quarter amid record capex spends
aiNews.summary: "The demand for tokens in the world has gone completely exponential," Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang said about the company's earnings.

aiNews.title: The White House wants AI companies to cover rate hikes. Most have already said they would.
aiNews.summary: Many hyperscalers have already made public commitments to cover electricity cost increases.

aiNews.title: Alphabet-owned robotics software company Intrinsic joins Google
aiNews.summary: Nearly five years after graduating into an independent Alphabet company, Intrinsic is moving under Google's domain.

aiNews.title: Snapchat announces ‘The Snappys,’ its first-ever creator awards show
aiNews.summary: Snapchat is the latest social media platform to launch awards for creators, joining TikTok and Instagram.

aiNews.title: An accountant won a big jackpot on Kalshi by betting against DOGE
aiNews.summary: A tax accountant saw Elon Musk fans bidding up a Kalshi prediction market and saw a sure bet to make easy money.

aiNews.title: Inside the story of the US defense contractor who leaked hacking tools to Russia

aiNews.title: Samsung shows off new display tech that adds a privacy screen to apps and notifications
aiNews.summary: The new privacy tech uses different types of pixels to let you block certain apps and notifications from being viewed by others.

aiNews.title: Wearable startup CUDIS launches a new health ring line with an AI-fueled ‘coach’
aiNews.summary: The wearable incentivizes healthy behavior with points that can be redeemed for health products.

aiNews.title: Kalshi fined a MrBeast editor for insider trading on markets related to the YouTube star
aiNews.summary: Kalshi fined the MrBeast editor, Artem Kaptur, over $20,000.

aiNews.title: The public opposition to AI infrastructure is heating up
aiNews.summary: Public backlash over the data center boom is leading to a variety of draconian policies — including bans on new construction.

aiNews.title: Waymo to begin testing in Chicago and Charlotte
aiNews.summary: Waymo this week will begin mapping and collecting data in Chicago and Charlotte. The move comes as Waymo announces it is currently operating its robotaxis fully autonomously in 10 US cities.

aiNews.title: Gemini can now automate some multi-step tasks on Android
aiNews.summary: Gemini on Android will be able to automate tasks involving rideshare requests, or grocery or food delivery, says Google.

aiNews.title: OpenAI COO says ads will be ‘an iterative process’
aiNews.summary: COO Brad Lightcap noted that ads can add to the product experience of users if they are done right. He urged to give OpenAI a few months to see how the company fares in rolling out the product.

aiNews.title: OpenClaw creator’s advice to AI builders is to be more playful and allow yourself time to improve
aiNews.summary: Peter Steinberger talks about the creation of his viral AI agent OpenClaw and how being more "playful" makes for a better way to learn AI coding.
